definitions.definition: this means juggling too many projects at once and something's bound to fail; when a smith had too many irons in his fire, he couldn't effectively keep track of all of them.

idiom_sense.idiom_name: too many irons in the fire

definitions.definition: implement used to brand live stock
home appliance consisting of a flat metal base that is heated and used to smooth cloth
a golf club that has a relatively narrow metal head
